body:
Hi @Sascha321 !
On OctoBot 0.3, trade history is only the history of the current session.
On OctoBot 0.4 (currenty in beta), this history also contains previous sessions when connected to an exchange account.

Hello GuillaumeDSM, thank you for your feedback.
Where can I then see if I have successful transactions? do I only see this with my broker?
Has the Kraken broker already been implemented? I get a captcha error message in the log.

On 0.3 they appear in trade history (successful transactions from the current octobot instance).
Kraken has not been tested yet on 0.3, it's one of the exchanges we will add in 0.4

Hello, I can't find any closed trades, weird.
in which directory are the logs? "../logs"?
I have already understood correctly that there is no history in the Webgui in 0.3

Logs are in the logs directory yes.
It's weird indeed, are you sure your bot made trades in your current instance ?

I really don't know if I made trades, I think I found 2 at Coinbase.
I noticed another bug there. If you click directly on the symbol of the crypto currency in trading "Market status" you will see the graph of the crypto currency. The symbol is always stored with the Trader Binance, and so you get the following error message in the log if there is nothing to display.
Is it actually OK if I show you the error messages here?

> 
 2020-08-26 17:11:07,021 ERROR    interfaces.web       Exception on /dashboard/currency_price_graph_update/binance/BTC|USD/5m/live [POST]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2447, in wsgi_app
    response = self.full_dispatch_request()
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1952, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1821, in handle_user_exception
    reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/_compat.py", line 39, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1950, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/home/pi/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1936, in dispatch_request
    return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
  File "/home/pi/OctoBot/interfaces/web/controllers/dashboard.py", line 33, in currency_price_graph_update
    backtesting=backtesting))
  File "/home/pi/OctoBot/interfaces/web/models/dashboard.py", line 200, in get_currency_price_graph_update
    exchange_list[exchange])
  File "/home/pi/OctoBot/evaluator/symbol_evaluator.py", line 202, in get_evaluator_task_managers
    return self.evaluator_task_managers[exchange.get_name()]
KeyError: 'binance'
>

Yes please, post your errors here, it will help to identify problems.

Thanks for the issue report on the web interface, this issue is fixed in 0.4 !

Trades will also appear on the home screen as red and green dots. as in backtesting

Hello

Most of my trades or pairings are canceled. Is this due to the attitudes or the fluctuations in the rate of the crypto currency?

Hello @Sascha321,
Yes, when using the daily trading mode, if a state goes from long to short (or the opposite), existing unfilled orders are cancelled because they are not relevant anymore.

This happens sometimes with 0.3 when there is too many things to update and the exchange is not replying fast enough, it's just a display issue and will not affect your bot's behavior

> the following question, does this error message have a negative effect

This is a hint to inform you that these exchanges are not allowing trading on these pairs, it will not have any effect on your bot (except that it will not trade these pairs on these exchanges, obviously)
